185.sentence: I installed, activated and registered NIS 2004 without issue.

186.sentence: So far, the Anti-Spam feature seems to be very good.

187.sentence: This program would not let me send Outlook Email or listen to Audible sample books online.

188.sentence: Buy this if you like mental challenges or trying how to pick locks.

189.sentence: I had much of the same problems that everyone else has listed (mainly the SLOOOOOOOOOW processor), and then I couldn't get the damn thing off my computer completely!

190.sentence: It locked during install and I had to reformat the drive and start from scratch (GRRRRRR!)

191.sentence: I downloaded a trial version of Computer Associates EZ Firewall and Antivirus and fell in love with a computer security system all over again.

192.sentence: And I can't warn you enough to STAY AWAY FROM NORTON!!

193.sentence: I did not have any of the installation problems that people highlighted here.

194.sentence: It was immediately noticeable that NIS slows down my computer (Pent4, 256 RAM).

195.sentence: I think it is a combination of the program size taking up resources and the open/close scanning that it does with every program.

196.sentence: Is it necessary to scan my MS Money database when I close the program?

197.sentence: I have a modern PC with lots of speed and memory, but this firewall just brought it to a halt.

198.sentence: Start up, log off, log on...everything became very slow.

199.sentence: Configuring it for a home network was almost impossible.

200.sentence: Multiple users on one machine never seemed to behave like you'd expect.

201.sentence: While I was trying to play Half Life 2 it started popping up with "alerts" every twenty seconds (literally), warning me my antivirus protection was off.

202.sentence: But it wouldn't let me turn the AV protection back on and it wouldn't stop with the alerts.

203.sentence: I had tried to uninstall Norton Internet Security a few weeks ago, and it wouldn't let me do that either.

204.sentence: I tried it again this morning and it said I didn't have the required "permissions" and lacked proper administrator status.

205.sentence: Of course, if you try to reach Symantec customer service you get useless automated systems unless you want to pay $30 per incident.

206.sentence: This time, it started the uninstallation process, then I left for work. I think it will work. I hope it will work.

207.sentence: I simply hate Symantec. I swear, if I could have physically ripped that software out of my computer with my bare, bleeding hands, I would have.

208.sentence: Their products have been great and have saved my bacon on numerous occasions.
